fields.value: Relational Data between Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The “Relational Data between Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change” (Relational UNFCCC Data) dataset contains dyadic data on how parties to the UNFCCC (i.e. member states or coalitions of member states) react to other parties’ oral interventions during the negotiations. 
Each observation in the dataset consists of a bargaining interaction between a country dyad, at a specific negotiation day, about a specific negotiation topic. The dataset includes 62 097 dyadic bargaining interactions among the 222 participants to the UNFCCC negotiations (including countries and coalitions) over a series of 461 negotiation days between 1995 and 2013. 
The dataset was obtained by hand-coding the Earth Negotiation Bulletins (ENBs). It covers all meetings of the official UNFCCC bodies reported in the ENBs between February 1995 (11th Session of the INC in New York) and December 2013 (COP19 in Warsaw).

files.description: This file describes the variables, coding rules and procedures, and data sources for all dyadic UNFCCC negotiations data, coalition membership data and UNFCCC ratification status data covered in the "Relational UNFCCC Data" dataset.
files.label: Codebook for Relational UNFCCC Data.pdf

dataFile.description: This file describes the variables, coding rules and procedures, and data sources for all dyadic UNFCCC negotiations data, coalition membership data and UNFCCC ratification status data covered in the "Relational UNFCCC Data" dataset.

files.description: Country-year panel that includes information on coalition membership of parties to the UNFCCC. Coalitions are more or less formal groupings of countries that voluntarily agree to coordinate positions and/or speak together at the negotiations in order to make their voice stronger. The data has been obtained from several web sources, including official websites of the respective coalitions, the UNFCCC website, and also written submissions to the UNFCCC.
files.label: country_groups.tab

dataFile.description: Country-year panel that includes information on coalition membership of parties to the UNFCCC. Coalitions are more or less formal groupings of countries that voluntarily agree to coordinate positions and/or speak together at the negotiations in order to make their voice stronger. The data has been obtained from several web sources, including official websites of the respective coalitions, the UNFCCC website, and also written submissions to the UNFCCC.

files.description: This is the main data file, which contains dyadic relational data between parties to the UNFCCC. The data was obtained by hand-coding, from the ENBs, how parties to the UNFCCC (i.e. member states or coalitions) react to other parties' oral interventions in the negotiations.
files.label: ENB_relationships.tab

dataFile.description: This is the main data file, which contains dyadic relational data between parties to the UNFCCC. The data was obtained by hand-coding, from the ENBs, how parties to the UNFCCC (i.e. member states or coalitions) react to other parties' oral interventions in the negotiations.

files.description: This data file includes a variable describing how active each UNFCCC party is in the oral negotiations. For each negotiation day, the variable counts how many times each party is reported by the ENB to make an intervention. The dataset is a full and balanced country-negotiation day panel. For each of the 461 negotiation days coded, it includes the whole set of 222 countries and coalitions identified to have ever made an oral intervention in the UNFCCC negotiations. The dataset has a total of 102 342 observations.
files.label: statements_count.tab

dataFile.description: This data file includes a variable describing how active each UNFCCC party is in the oral negotiations. For each negotiation day, the variable counts how many times each party is reported by the ENB to make an intervention. The dataset is a full and balanced country-negotiation day panel. For each of the 461 negotiation days coded, it includes the whole set of 222 countries and coalitions identified to have ever made an oral intervention in the UNFCCC negotiations. The dataset has a total of 102 342 observations.

files.description: This file includes information on date of ratification, entry into force and withdrawal of both the UNFCCC and its Kyoto Protocol by their member states. The data was obtained from the UNFCCC website.
files.label: unfccc_ratification.tab

dataFile.description: This file includes information on date of ratification, entry into force and withdrawal of both the UNFCCC and its Kyoto Protocol by their member states. The data was obtained from the UNFCCC website.

files.description: This file lists all variable names and labels, as well as the most important value labels used in the main dataset (“ENB_relationships.dta”).
files.label: Variable and value labels.tab
